Many countries also have Daylight Saving Time (DST) for part of the year, the time service will automatically switch to this at the appropriate time unless DST has been disabled.

For example 'Eastern Standard Time' represents both EST (UTC-05:00) and EDT (UTC-04:00)

The Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) will use these values in a scripted install, e.g.

TimeZone=004

TimeZoneName=Pacific Standard Time

'GMT Standard Time' is a Microsoft term, and should not be confused with 'Greenwich Mean Time' (GMT)

Greenwich Mean Time implies no daylight savings.

This table is intended as an aid to help select time zone data appropriate for your practical needs. It is not intended to take or endorse any position on legal or territorial claims.

“These are really terribly rough times, and we really should try to be as nice to each other as possible” ~ Lou Reed, 2003 interview.

Related commands

Windows Locales - Regional standards for date and time formatting.

Q3162835 - June 2016 DST and time zone update for Windows.

Q3013410 - December 2014 cumulative time zone update for Windows Operating Systems.

TZUTIL - Time Zone Utility.

W32TM - Time Service.

PowerShell: Get-TimeZone / Set-TimeZone

Wikipedia - List of TZ database time zones (use these for Unix/macOS)

The IANA Time Zone Database - Github, data with local time for many locales around the globe (tz, tzdb or zoneinfo).

Time.is - Atomic clock.

Time Zone News - TimeandDate.com
